sentences.en: But the authorities turned a deaf ear to their demands.
sentences.cn: 但当局不理睬他们的要求.

sentences.en: communication between deaf and hearing people
sentences.cn: 失聪者和听力正常者之间的交流

sentences.en: He always turns a deaf ear to other people's criticism.
sentences.cn: 他对别人对他的批评总是听而不闻.

sentences.en: He turned a deaf ear to my request for help.
sentences.cn: 他对于我的求助置若罔闻.

sentences.en: He turned a deaf ear to the instruction given by his teacher.
sentences.cn: 他对老师的教导塞耳不闻.

sentences.en: He was a very unusual musician inasmuch as he was totally deaf.
sentences.cn: 他是完全失聪的，从这点上来说，他是个很了不起的音乐家。

sentences.en: I think Mum’s going a bit deaf .
sentences.cn: 我觉得妈妈有点耳聋了。

sentences.en: I'm quite deaf — you'll have to speak up.
sentences.cn: 我耳背——你得大声说。

sentences.en: It is wrong to turn a deaf ear to other's criticism.
sentences.cn: 对别人的批评充耳不闻是错误的.

sentences.en: Many deaf people have feelings of isolation and loneliness.
sentences.cn: 很多失聪者都有孤独无助的感觉。

sentences.en: Many regular TV programs are captioned for the deaf.
sentences.cn: 许多常规的电视节目都为耳聋者配了字幕。

sentences.en: Mary turned a deaf ear to Lois's asking to ride her bicycle.
sentences.cn: 洛伊丝向玛丽借自行车,玛丽假装没听见.

sentences.en: She was born deaf and dumb .
sentences.cn: 她天生又聋又哑。

sentences.en: She was deaf to his pleas.
sentences.cn: 她对他的恳求充耳不闻。

sentences.en: She’s deaf and dumb (= unable to hear or speak ) and communicates using sign language.
sentences.cn: 她又聋又哑，用手语交流。

sentences.en: subtitles for the deaf and the hard of hearing
sentences.cn: 为耳聋和听力不佳者打出的字幕

sentences.en: The partly deaf man inclined forward to hear the conversation more clearly.
sentences.cn: 那个耳朵半聋的人把身子往前凑,以便把谈话听得更清楚.

sentences.en: The provincial assembly were deaf to all pleas for financial help.
sentences.cn: 省议会对所有的经济救助请求都充耳不闻。

sentences.en: The two deaf actors converse solely in signing.
sentences.cn: 两名聋哑演员独自用手语交谈。

sentences.en: Tom was born profoundly deaf (= having great difficulty hearing ) .
sentences.cn: 汤姆天生几乎全聋。

words.tran_cn: 耳聋；后天耳聋（deafen的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 失聪的，不愿听，不去注意
trans.tran_en: physically unable to hear anything or unable to hear well
